Name: Painted wooden Osiris figure
Description: Painted wooden figure of Ptah-Sokar-Osiris, with red background wrapping, and a column of hieroglyphs down the lower front body and back column. The surface is much worn, and the pedestal and crown of the body are lost. Such figures were placed in the tomb as guarantors of rebirth, in rich burials of the 1st millennium BC. The hieroglyphs on the back of this example identify the tomb-owner in this case as a man called Pasherenaset son of Padiwesir, names characteristic of the Late Period and Ptolemaic Period.
